jobs.name: munger-mental-models
jobs.description: Daily Charlie Munger mental model training for Anthony

payload.message: It's time for Anthony's daily Munger mental model lesson! Check memory/munger-mental-models.md for the curriculum and progress. Send the next model in the interactive format: explain the concept, give a real example, then pose a challenge question for Anthony to respond to. Update the progress tracker after sending.

jobs.name: weight-loss-monday-weighin
jobs.description: Monday morning weigh-in prompt for Anthony

payload.message: Monday morning weigh-in time for Anthony! Check memory/anthony-weight-loss.md for context and previous weights. Ask him: 1) What's the scale say this morning? 2) How was the weekend with eating? Keep it brief and encouraging. Log the weight in the progress table.

jobs.name: weight-loss-daily-plan
jobs.description: Daily action plan for Anthony's weight loss

payload.message: Send Anthony his daily weight loss action plan. Check memory/anthony-weight-loss.md for his constraints. Consider: what day of week is it (office days Wed/Thu are harder), his 4-hour post-meal exercise restriction, and his equipment (Peloton, dumbbells, indoor walks). Give ONE specific, actionable recommendation for today - could be exercise (e.g. '20 min fasted Peloton before breakfast'), nutrition (e.g. 'kitchen closes at 9 PM tonight'), or mindset. Keep it short and motivating - 2-3 sentences max. End with an emoji.

jobs.name: weight-loss-friday-checkin
jobs.description: Friday weight loss check-in with Anthony

payload.message: It's Friday check-in time for Anthony's weight loss journey! Check memory/anthony-weight-loss.md for context. Ask him: 1) How did the week go with evening snacking? 2) What's his weight today? 3) Any workouts completed? 4) REMIND HIM to send a Cal.ai screenshot or weekly calorie average! Update the progress log. Be encouraging but real.

Check ClawdBot API costs. Run: python C:\Users\afrad\.clawdbot\clawd\clawdbot-telegram\skills\cost-tracker\scripts\track_cost.py check --json. If needs_alert is true, tell me costs exceeded the threshold.
